For a secondary

Assess not less

				and career ready:

Student scores on
				the ACT.

Student scores on
				the SAT.

The percentage
				of students who attend an institution of higher education.

College

Results from
				Advanced Placement or International Baccalaureate exams.

Student grade
				point averages at an institution of higher education.

				completion of the first year at an institution of higher education.

establish a

				model plans, based on the criteria described in

appoint
				individuals to the peer-review process who are representative of parents,

				are familiar with educational standards, assessments, accountability, the needs
				of low-performing schools, and other educational needs of students;

if the Secretary
				determines that the State plan does not meet the requirements of this
				paragraph, immediately notify the State of such determination and the reasons
				for such determination;

not decline to
				approve a State's accountability model plan before—

offering the
				State an opportunity to revise its accountability model plan;

providing a
				hearing; and

allowing the
				State to communicate with peer reviewers in order to further explain or justify
				the merits of the State's accountability model plan; and

have the authority
				to disapprove a State accountability model plan for not meeting the
				requirements of this paragraph, but shall not have the authority to require a
				State, as a condition of approval of the State accountability model plan, to
				include in, or delete from, such plan 1 or more specific elements of the
				State's academic content standards or to use specific academic assessment
				instruments or items.
